channel.title: BUbuisnessAndMarket
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbuisnessAndMarket, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Markets might be celebrating but every single portfolio manager is trying to figure out how long the roller coaster will last
item.description: With China tariffs increased to 125% but other tariffs on pause, there is a treasure trove of open questions for investors and CEOs to contend with.

item.title: Stock market stages an epic rally. But volatility is likely to continue.
Trump didn’t care that the stock market was crashing. Bond yields were the ‘pain point’ that finally got him to pause tariffs
item.description: An alarming spike in 10-year Treasury yields finally persuaded Trump to act on tariffs.

item.title: AI’s job boom? Not before the bust
item.description: The gap between the AI displacement of jobs and the AI creation of jobs is where the real problem lies.

item.title: Why Chipotle won’t raise prices because of tariffs, according to CEO Scott Boatwright
item.description: "I think it's unfair to the consumer to pass those costs off to the consumer, because pricing is permanent," Boatwright told Fortune.

item.title: Walmart CEO says ‘there will be a Christmas’ despite lingering fears of a trade war
item.description: The retailer has not canceled any orders yet because of the tariff drama.

item.title: Why choppy bond yields are the hidden danger that could crush software stocks
Volatility ETFs halted as VIX sees biggest drop ever after Trump’s tariff pause
Dow books 2,900-point gain, Nasdaq up 12% as stocks soar on Trump's tariff pause
Why bond-market tumult likely peaked this morning — before Trump’s tariff pause
